page.title: 15LOCAL GOVERNMENT IN WALSALL
page.content:
{Walsall Metropolitan Borough}began in {1974}when{Aldridge-Brownhills Urban {District}joined with{Walsall County {Borough. Willenhall and Darlaston}had already joined in{1966. This reorganization meant an increase in the work of the council. A new {Civic Centre}was built to take the overflow from the Council House. The Council has established {Neighbourhood Offices}to provide local Housing Department services. There are{60 councillors}elected periodically, meeting for Council Meetings every 6 weeks on Mondays at 6pm.
{Walsall}has 3 local{MPs:}Richard Shepherd (Con) Aldridge and Brownhills , David Winnick (Lab) Walsall North and Bruce George (Lab) Walsall South.
